sentences.en: A stupid fellow is talkative; a wise man is meditative.
sentences.cn: 蠢人饶舌, 智者思虑.

sentences.en: Edward was not talkative and the conversation rested usually with Bertha.
sentences.cn: 爱德华不爱说话,谈话通常都是要靠伯莎的.

sentences.en: He became animated and talkative after two drinks.
sentences.cn: 他一饮酒就变得兴奋,话也多起来了.

sentences.en: He didn't want company, talkative or otherwise.
sentences.cn: 他不想跟人搭伴，不管这个伴儿是否健谈。

sentences.en: He is talkative when he has a few drinks under his belt.
sentences.cn: 他几杯酒下肚话就多了.

sentences.en: He suddenly became very talkative, his face slightly flushed, his eyes much brighter.
sentences.cn: 他的话突然多了起来，脸颊微微泛红，双眼明亮许多。

sentences.en: He's not very talkative, is he?
Mary was sometimes overshadowed by the more talkative members of the family.
sentences.cn: 有时家中更健谈的人使玛丽显得黯然失色.

sentences.en: Never talkative, he was even more taciturn now.
sentences.cn: 原先他就不喜欢说话, 现在更不爱开口了.

sentences.en: People began forming into little talkative groups.
sentences.cn: 人们开始一组一组地聚在一起议论.

sentences.en: She now than formerly more not talkative.
sentences.cn: 她现在比以前较不健谈.
她是个活泼爱说话的人.

sentences.en: Sue is the extrovert in the family; opinionated, talkative and passionate about politics.
sentences.cn: 苏是家中的外向行动派，性格固执，能说会道，而且对政治非常热衷。

sentences.en: The talkative woman is always barging in other people's conversation.
sentences.cn: 那个多嘴的妇人总是爱插嘴.

sentences.en: They were not talkative at supper that night.
sentences.cn: 当晚吃饭时,大家的话都不怎么多.

words.tran_cn: 说话的，多嘴的；有表情的
说话的人；健谈者；空谈者
饶舌的；多话的；多嘴的；爱说话的

trans.tran_cn: 健谈的，多嘴的，喜欢说话的，喋喋
trans.tran_en: someone who is talkative talks a lot
